Master Answer:
The MMR is a live, attenuated vaccine. Live vaccines are made from a weakened version of the germ that causes the disease, so there is no concern about transmitting a disease-causing virus from a recently vaccinated individual. If you have further questions, please contact your immunization provider.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: Hello, my question is..... can an individual who has just been vaccinated for MMR visit a new born baby in the hospital or visit a grandparent in a care home?
Master Question variation 0: can an individual who has been vaccinated for immr visit a newborn child in the hospital
Master Question variation 1: can a vaccinated for an mmr visit a grandparent
